alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Cheshire; Merrimack; Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Carroll; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 08 at 3:09PM EDT until July 08 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in New Hampshire, Western And Central Hillsborough. In central New Hampshire, Belknap, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Northern Carroll, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Carroll, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving low pressure will track from the Mid-Atlantic north into New England Sunday night into Monday night. This system will produce lines of slow moving showers and thunderstorms which could produce torrential downpours and lead to flash flooding. There is added concern given the current very wet ground.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
